isadora
  • isadora.base
  • View page source

isadora.base

Base atmospheric models for the ISADORA package.

This module implements the International Standard Atmosphere (ISA) up to the stratosphere. It provides abstractions for atmospheric layers and a high-level ISA interface to compute atmospheric properties such as temperature, pressure, density, viscosity, speed of sound, Mach number, and dynamic pressure as a function of altitude.

All internal computations are performed in SI units, while user-facing values are converted back to the active user-defined unit system.

Notes

  • Valid only for altitudes from sea level up to the stratosphere (~47 km geopotential height).

  • Supports both geometric and geopotential altitudes.

Classes

AtmosphericLayer IsothermalLayer ISATroposphere ISATropopause ISAStratosphere ISA

Module Contents

isadora.base._is_altitude
class isadora.base.AtmosphericLayer

Abstract base class for ISA atmospheric layers.

Each atmospheric layer must implement temperature and pressure as functions of altitude.

lapse_rate

Temperature lapse rate of the layer.

Type:

float

Notes

This class should not be instantiated directly.

lapse_rate: float = 0.0
abstract property temperature

Temperature at the current altitude.

Returns:

Temperature corresponding to the altitude within the layer.

Return type:

temperature

abstract property pressure

Pressure at the current altitude.

Returns:

Pressure corresponding to the altitude within the layer.

Return type:

pressure

class isadora.base.IsothermalLayer(parent)

Bases: AtmosphericLayer

Base class for ISA isothermal atmospheric layers.

In an isothermal layer, temperature does not vary with altitude.

Parameters:

parent (ISA) – Parent ISA instance providing altitude and unit context.

lapse_rate

Temperature lapse rate (zero for isothermal layers).

Type:

float

parent

Reference to the owning ISA instance.

Type:

ISA

lapse_rate: float = 0.0
parent
property temperature

Returns:

Constant temperature value.

Return type:

temperature

class isadora.base.ISATropopause(parent)

Bases: AtmosphericLayer

ISA tropopause atmospheric layer (11 km – 25 km).

The tropopause is an isothermal layer where temperature remains constant with altitude.

Parameters:

parent (ISA) – Parent ISA instance.

base_temperature

Temperature at the base of the tropopause.

base_pressure

Pressure at the base of the tropopause.

base_density

Density at the base of the tropopause.

base_height

Base altitude of the tropopause layer.

base_temperature
base_pressure
base_density
base_height

class isadora.base.ISATroposphere(parent)

Bases: AtmosphericLayer

ISA troposphere atmospheric layer (0 km – 11 km).

The troposphere exhibits a negative temperature lapse rate.

Parameters:

parent (ISA) – Parent ISA instance.

class isadora.base.ISAStratosphere(parent)

Bases: AtmosphericLayer

ISA stratosphere atmospheric layer (20 km – 47 km).

The stratosphere is divided into lower and upper regions, each with different lapse rates.

Parameters:

parent (ISA) – Parent ISA instance.

lapse_rate
base_temp
base_pressure

isadora.base._choose_atmosphere(altitude)

Select the appropriate ISA atmospheric layer.

Parameters:

altitude – Geopotential altitude in kilometers (SI).

Returns:

layer – Atmospheric layer class.

Return type:

AtmosphericLayer

Raises:

Exception – If altitude exceeds stratospheric limits.

class isadora.base.ISA(*, offset: float = 0.0, geopotential_height: float = 0.0)

International Standard Atmosphere (ISA) model.

Provides access to atmospheric properties as a function of altitude.

Parameters:

  • offset (float, optional) – Temperature offset applied to all layers.

  • geopotential_height (float, optional) – Geopotential altitude.

Notes

Altitude inputs are converted internally to SI units.

atmosphere = None
msl_density = 1.2250122659907
msl_pressure = 101325.0
msl_temperature = 288.15
msl_gamma: float = 1.4
msl_dynamic_viscosity = 1.7894e-05
classmethod from_geometric_height(offset: float = 0.0, geometric_height: float = 0.0)

  • geometric_height (float) – Geometric altitude.

Returns:

ISA instance.
